page.title: 10Ecology Lliedi Reservoir
page.content: Known locally as the Swiss Valley,the Lower Lliedi area is characterised by impressive views and quiet walks in mature mixed woodland,the presence of water providing that added Swiss flavour! The reservoir supplies 11.4 million litres per day (2.5 million gallons) of unfiltered water for industrial usage in the Llanelli area. The 50 year old Scots pine provide one of the many attractive features. Other trees on the banks of the reservoir are oak,hazel,ash,alder and elder. There is a great variety of bird life here including woodpigeons,a variety of tits -e.g. great,blue,coal and marsh, also nuthatches,woodpeckers and crows.Water species include coots, moorhens and herons. In the water there are brown trout,minnows and eels.
